intro: Souroubea loczyi subsp. loczyi, commonly known as the loczy's souroubea, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive morphology, including hairy stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
